Key Match Events: Bangladesh beats Zimbabwe by 3 runs in a last-ball drama.
Najmul Hossain Shanto scored a solid 55-ball 71, his first international half-century.
Taskin Ahmed took crucial wickets, including Chakabva and Madhevere.
Mustafizur Rahman took two wickets, including the key wicket of Sikandar Raza.
Sean Williams and Ryan Burl forged a partnership to resist Bangladesh's attack.
Blessing Muzarabani took two early wickets for Zimbabwe.
Sikandar Raza removed the dangerous Shanto with a timely strike.
Sean Williams provided an important breakthrough by dismissing Shakib Al Hasan.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and opted to bat first.
Pitch Report: Conditions were perfect for a T20 game with a few cracks on the surface.
Zimbabwe was riding high on confidence after stunning Pakistan.
Post-Match Reflections: Relief for Bangladesh as they avoided a defeat by just three runs.
The drama at Brisbane comes to an end with Bangladesh pocketing two valuable points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Gabba had glorious conditions with sunshine.
Bangladesh fans were singing the late Ayub Bachchu’s iconic ‘Shei Tumi...’ as they walked in.
Zimbabwe fans were cheering for Brad Evans.
Star Sports Network broadcasted the match, and it was live-streamed on Disney+ Hotstar.
